Description.val: This line item funds modifications to Airborne Electronic Attack (AEA) products used on multiple platforms. Modifications budgeted and programmed include: procurement and enhancement of the AN/ALQ-99 Tactical Jamming System (TJS) and Low Band Transmitter Antenna Group (LBT AG) inventory, AN/ALQ-99 TJS upgrades and related sustainability, capability, and viability modifications. AEA will support procurement of new technologies and equipment as needed to combat emerging and evolving electronic warfare technology and systems.

Justification.val:
The Department of the Navy has been tasked with accomplishing the Nation's AEA mission in various theaters of operation over the last few decades. The AEA capability fielded by the Navy on the EA-18G Growler and EA-6B Prowler has been a high demand, low density asset. The Navy and Marine Corps are transitioning away from the EA-6B Prowler aircraft; the Navy has transitioned to the EA-18G Growler aircraft and the Marine Corps is transitioning to an organic capability utilizing electronic warfare payloads flown on Marine Corps aircraft. Stable investment in AEA systems will ensure continued availability of AEA capability to meet warfighter demand. Investment in the AN/ALQ-99 TJS will ensure continued system availability until Next Generation Jammer (NGJ) achieves Full Operational Capability across all bands of the Electromagnetic Spectrum (EMS).

AEA System procurements and related efforts are required to combat emerging electronic warfare technology and systems. Investment in AEA System efforts will ensure that sufficient AEA capability
is available to meet warfighter requirements.

The FY 2019 funding request was reduced by $18.931 million to account for the availability of prior year execution balances.

Name.@footnote: Support Equipment fluctuates from FY 2018 - FY 2023 due to efforts to re-engineer and procure Nondestructive Eddy Current Inspection Set, De-air Fluid Cooling System, Electronic Tactical Pod Tester, and LBC Operation Test Program Set.
Other Support increases in FY 2018 - FY 2020 due to LBC government and contracted production testing and AN/ALQ-99 program execution adjustments.

Transmitters include procurement of Low Band Transmitter Antenna Group, Band 2, Band 4, Band 5/6, Band 7, Band 8 and Band 9/10, and antennas.  Yearly unit cost varies based on type and quantity of transmitter/antenna procured.
Vertical Polarized (VPOL) Antenna broken out from Transmitters for budget clarity and includes procurement of antennas in FY 2019 and FY 2020.

Radomes broken out from Transmitters for budget clarity and includes procurement of EA-18G Extended Low Band Radome (GELBR) in FY 2018. Yearly unit cost varies based on type and quantity of radome procured.
NAVAIR Commander's Speed to Fleet Initiative includes procurement of Batwing Reflector for the Band 9/10 Transmitter in FY 2017 and FY 2018.

Description.val:
This Operational and Safety Improvement Program covers system modifications required to improve AN/ALQ-99 reliability, maintainability, availability, resolve obsolescence issues, and correct deficiencies found in testing or in the
field. Engineering changes are needed to enhance mission capability and integration of evolving Electronic Warfare systems to address increased mission requirements and emerging threats in support of EA-6B and EA-18G aircraft.
The out of production transmitter inventory is static and is being stretched due to increasing electronic warfare aircraft numbers and mission requirements. The AN/ALQ-99 TJS consists of six transmitters that are mission configurable depending on target threat. Reconstitution of reclaimed United States Air Force (USAF) EF-111 Band 4 through 8 transmitters to United States Navy (USN) configuration will alleviate significant jammer inventory shortfalls for EA-6B and EA-18G platforms.

B KITS: AN/ALQ-99 TJS hardware procurements include Hardback, Pod Interface Unit (PIU), the Universal Exciter Upgrade (UEU), Low Band Transmitter Antenna Group (LBT AG), Band 2, Band 4, Band 5/6, Band 7, Band 8 and Band 9/10 Transmitters and Antennas, Vertical Polarized (VPOL) Antenna, Batwing Reflector for the Band 9/10 Transmitter, Low Band Consolidation (LBC), and Radomes to include procurement of EA-18G Extended Low Band Radome (GELBR) and Universal High Band Radome (UHBR).

INSTALLATION EQUIPMENT N/R: AN/ALQ-99 TJS obsolescence mitigation efforts, capability and reliability enhancements require non-recurring engineering for AN/ALQ-99 TJS components such as the Hardback, PIU, the UEU, LBT AG, Band 2, Band 4, Band 5/6, Band 7, Band 8 and Band 9/10 Transmitters and Antennas. Efforts planned for FY 2019 and FY 2020 include additional engineering and design work for the consolidation of the Low Band Transmitter and Band 4 Transmitter into a single form factor with production commencing in FY 2021, referred to as LBC.

SUPPORT EQUIPMENT: Introduction of new/modified AN/ALQ-99 pod equipment requires new/modified organizational, intermediate, and depot level support equipment; such as modifications and additions to the AN/ALQ-99 pod test set to support LBT AG, modifications to the High Power Device Test Set to extend frequency coverage to test Band 9/10 Transmitters, and efforts to re-engineer and procure Nondestructive (NDI) eddy current inspection set, De-air Fluid Cooling System (DFCS), electronic Tactical Pod Tester (e-TPT), and LBC Operational Test Program Set (OTPS). Required changes to existing support equipment will improve reliability, maintainability, availability, address obsolescence issues, and correct deficiencies found in testing or in the field.  Additionally, funds will provide for depot support equipment in order to resolve AN/ALQ-99 readiness degraders.

DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES: LBC conducted Critical Design Review (CDR) in July 2017 and will reach production in FY 2021.

The FY 2019 funding request was reduced by $18.931 million to account for the availability of prior year execution balances.
